title: Shout Out to Junglers Who Buy Pink Wards!
body:
Thank you to those junglers that buy pinks on their first/second back and place them in the river :D

If you aren't one of them, start being one of them >:(

replies.body: if I have spare cash and an empty space in my pockets, I get {{item:2043}} , no matter the role. Vision safes lives, and my life is pretty precious to me.

> Vision safes lives, and my life is pretty precious to me.


This was even funnier because you had the draven icon
I sometimes do it even if I already have one on the map.

Sometime I put is in the bush on the backside of red if there's a shaco/zac/lee where they can gank mid from behind

Idk, you're welcome doe <3

a yellow is good enough over there imo, you don't need the vision 24/7 since enemy junglers dont pass there often. But the river is a hotspot when they wanna gank.

Regardless, take my upvote for your warding skills +1

With counter junglers like Shaco/Lee I find it best to have that pink there (as an Amumu main It's quite appealing to know if I'm walking to my death just to get to krugs)

So it's both for my protection and mid's

You also have to think about it being on your side of the map. If an enemy tries to kill the pink your mid and jungle have decent time to fight him 2v1 since pinks take 4 autos. Since you can keep it alive its most effiecent than just trinket warding, where you can ward more aggressively with your trinket like enemy wraiths. Also you can move up the pink to like drag or something if needed. Pink there is extreamly good.

Jungle entrances are always good spots for pink wards, and by red, there's a bush across from it that gives good vision of that side of the jungle. The bush in the center of the river is alright too, but too many people pass through it. The bush next to it, at the edge of the jungle, can provide just about as much vision of a possible gank.
oh thanks. here i was thinking about all the gold i thought i wasted.

That should be all junglers... In fact it should be all players in all roles in every match...

I know we all buy pinks regardless of role in diamond. Vision tools were severely nerfed at the beginning of this season. You need every edge you can get now a days.
Very rarely do diamond laners buy pinks on their first back, even on second back tbh. Everyone buys them at the end of laning, or they buy during laning and save them for when the team takes drag.

> [{quoted}](name=Wildlash2,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=f8O3kLrA,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-06-06T13:37:04.416+0000)
>
> Very rarely do diamond laners buy pinks on their first back, even on second back tbh. Everyone buys them at the end of laning, or they buy during laning and save them for when the team takes drag.

I buy them any time I have an item slot open and 75 gold available left over after any more important purchases. I don't know about first back, I can't really give you a time we do this on a regular basis. But most diamond level players average about 3 pinks purchased per match. I'm a little bit closer to 4 myself, but I always did more warding than your average player. Before we removed vision wards from the shop this preseason I would average just less than a ward placed per minute from non support roles. As a support it was probably closer to an average of 60 per game. I liked to ward. A lot. Information is power my friend.

I'm a bronze player that averages almost 1 ward per minute as a jungler. 

And it's so true that without our stealth wards, vision is a lot harder to come by, and the laners need to help with that. Junglers and supports aren't the only people who should be warding. 

I've seen laners place 8 wards in a 60 minute game. Yellow trinket the entire game, and 8 wards. I've even seen a jungler place 4 wards with yellow trinket after 45 or so minutes. There's absolutely no reason for that...
I miss green wards so much ;-; I used to buy the crap out of them

I think the main reason they got rid of green wards was because 

1. On low elos no one would buy them, they just expect the support to do all the warding. So i think hey wanted to promote team warding. Restrict the amount of wards a support can hae to force the rest of the team to buy them. And low and behold the ward changes changed nothing because MOST people on low elos still just use trinkets and cry "we have no vision" when the supports wards run out. 

2. I think because of all the trolls that would do nothing to help the team and would just fill up all their item slots with green wards and then drop 30 of them in your base while the enemy was destroying it,

Though these may or may not be the reasons that 2nd one was annoying as hell. Just as annoying as these full AP annie, lux and nidalee supports that never buy a sightstone. The Nids that do that are the worst out of them 3...at least the lux can snare....the nids just change form and run and leap to safety while your ass is getting thrashed. So to all you full AP nid supports....NO your traps are not enough..buy a damn sightstone.

Everyone should buy one. The max I have seen is three at one time but if every player bought one the vision would be great, especially with how easy riot made warding with trinks and support items, i simply do not understand having 0 vision in the jungle
A lot of laners don't think they can afford to miss cs when they walk to the jungle to ward :'(

Or you could just learn how to control the waves of minions to give you an opening to quickly place a ward. There's a few great spots for laners to place wards that will help give your jungler a large amount of control over the game. A good jungler also has his eye on all 3 lanes and the map more than any single lane, so the extra vision can save you from a gank someday, or give you a free kill when you catch the enemy jungler roaming in your own jungle. 

Vision is too powerful, placing one pink is worth one or two lost cs. A pink ward catching site of an enemy player on one side of the map, frees you up to make a move on the other.
I'm the guy who buys a pink every back to tilt whoever though they could ward.
As a mid lane main, I thank those whom ward one of my 2 bushes.
As a midlaner, you SHOULD get one for one of your bushes. I can't lane knowing I have vision on one bush while the other is dark.  Too risky.
It can work against certain champs. You can hug the side that has a ward on it a little more and stay away from the unwarded and just go through river and up to your buff to avoid a gank.
The pros of being {{champion:64}}
I made a consumable section on the third row of my item set specifically to remind me to buy pink wards. Otherwise I'd never buy them lol.
Yup, having those sorts of things is great for reminders. I do the same for trinkets and such.
Always pink ward the enemy blue/red buff
I only buy it for top lane because I know I'm never going to gank top after lvl 3, so it's just that 1 piece of incentive for top laner to not RQ

Tbh I still don't know how to place wards.

I'll buy a pink being all like "Look at me, I'm such a team player!", walk around with it for a bit, and slap it down on some random river bush to feel useful.
You know exactly how to ward.  You buy it and slap it down in some random river bush.  If everyone on your team buys one you can fill every river bush with them.
{{item:3711}} {{item:3364}}  all the way, + my pink
Exactly, arguably it's overpowered, but since it's not one shotting people, nobody seems to notice. lol

I buy it at the beginning instead of 3 pots, 1 pot and 1 pink....

^.^
Thats actually kind of counter productive. Your team wants you to be helpful, not have a jungler who is behind from the start
I don't really have problems jungling, I don't have to go back early or anything :/

That's a great start for WW, but if you're in a situation where you're vs a stronger control or counter jungler, then pots are nice. At least one pot and one pink. 

But the extra health sustain will be great if you're invaded early.

As a support main of 5 years now turned jungler main, i always have a pink ward on the map and mostly play junglers who can get away with buying the SS jungle item because I know how important vision is to winning. Too bad my supports don't ...

I always get the tracker's knife and pink wars as a jungle main of 6 years, I know vision can make or break a game. Some of the closest games I've ever had were won via vision control. Also, tracker's knife allows you to get a sweeper, so you're able to control vision on the level of a support, while having the combat or dueling strength of a solo laner. 

At the end of those close games, one look at the statistics, and you notice that your team placed 50% more wards than the other team. That's a well earned victory.
always place it by blue river bush, to at least stop bot ganks like that.
I always pick a few up each game! Especially when I plan on invading, i'll put a deep pink ward somewhere so it will last until someone finds it.
I do that and I main top, does that count? You always need help for dem Shakos.
Been doing this for a few years now. Every single game as a jungler i grab a pink on my first back and drop it somewhere in the river.

I love these Junglers.

It makes my job as Support alot more easier.
Is it bad that I buy and place more pink wards as a jungler than any other person on my team the majority of my games ;3;?
This is my advice to anyone exploring darker parts without wards...Be ready to get raped at all times.
Ty ty
I know I've been more consistent lately in buying Pinks on my recalls. I'm trying. >>;;
Pink wards are life. Literally.

I guess you will loveme then lol......When i jungle voli i get a sightstone.  Some people down it but hell, its voli,,,,,he needs health and it gives it to him and vision. And helps the Support in having 2 SS in the game. If they get it,..some ap supports dont tho.
